results.definition: an unofficial association of people or groups
examples: the smart set goes there

results.definition: get ready for a particular purpose or event
examples: set up an experiment
set the table

results.definition: several exercises intended to be done in series
examples: he did four sets of the incline bench press

results.definition: representation consisting of the scenery and other properties used to identify the location of a dramatic production
examples: the sets were meticulously authentic

results.definition: a relatively permanent inclination to react in a particular way
examples: the set of his mind was obvious

results.definition: disappear beyond the horizon
examples: the sun sets early these days

results.definition: decide upon or fix definitely
put or set (seeds, seedlings, or plants) into the ground
establish as the highest level or best performance
examples: set a record

results.definition: urge to attack someone
set down according to a plan
examples: a carefully laid table with places set for four people

results.definition: (usually followed by `to' or `for') on the point of or strongly disposed
examples: we are set to go at any time

results.definition: converted to solid form (as concrete)
make ready or suitable or equip in advance for a particular purpose or for some use, event, etc
determined or decided upon as by an authority
examples: the time set for the launching

results.definition: equip with sails or masts
insert (a nail or screw below the surface, as into a countersink)
locate
examples: The film is set in Africa

results.definition: fixed and unmoving
examples: with eyes set in a fixed glassy stare
his bearded face already has a set hollow look

results.definition: put into a certain place or abstract location
adapt for performance in a different way
examples: set this poem to music

results.definition: (psychology) being temporarily ready to respond in a particular way
examples: the subjects' set led them to solve problems the familiar way and to overlook the simpler solution
his instructions deliberately gave them the wrong set

results.definition: become gelatinous
situated in a particular spot or position
examples: a house set on a hilltop

results.definition: fix conclusively or authoritatively
examples: set the rules

results.definition: evil Egyptian god with the head of a beast that has high square ears and a long snout; brother and murderer of Osiris
arrange attractively
alter or regulate so as to achieve accuracy or conform to a standard
estimate
the process of becoming hard or solid by cooling or drying or crystallization
examples: he tested the set of the glue

results.definition: bear fruit
set in type
examples: My book will be typeset nicely
set these words in italics

results.definition: a group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used
examples: a set of books
a set of golf clubs
a set of teeth

results.definition: any electronic equipment that receives or transmits radio or tv signals
examples: the early sets ran on storage batteries

results.definition: apply or start
examples: set fire to a building

results.definition: a unit of play in tennis or squash
examples: they played two sets of tennis after dinner

results.definition: being below the horizon
examples: the moon is set

results.definition: fix in a border
examples: The goldsmith set the diamond

results.definition: give a fine, sharp edge to a knife or razor
(mathematics) an abstract collection of numbers or symbols
examples: the set of prime numbers is infinite

results.definition: put into a certain state; cause to be in a certain state
examples: set the house afire

results.definition: put into a position that will restore a normal state
examples: set a broken bone

results.definition: set to a certain position or cause to operate correctly
examples: set clocks or instruments

results.definition: the act of putting something in position
examples: he gave a final set to his hat

results.definition: the descent of a heavenly body below the horizon
examples: before the set of sun
